foreword.title: Foreword
foreword.p: This document incorporates by reference the CalConnect Intellectual Property Rights, Appropriate Usage, Trademarks and Disclaimer of Warranty for External (Public) Documents as located at

admonition.p: All documents included in the zip file for Meet CalConnect 2008 are considered part of CD 0812 and the public disclaimer included by reference above applies to all contents of the file.

clause.title: What is different about mobile calendaring?
Charter
clause.p: The goal of the Mobile technical committee is to identify the issues associated with mobile calendaring & scheduling and propose recommendations on how to address any problem areas.
This TC will provide the Consortium with information on the current state of mobile calendaring & scheduling and gather requirements and use cases specific to mobile environments.
The TC will promote adoption of open calendaring standards for mobile devices (e.g. iCalendar and CalDAV) and create best practice documents as needed to assist implementation of these standards.
To achieve these goals, the TC intends to work in concert with organisations and vendors in the mobile industry.

clause.title: Mobile Calendaring Questionnaire
clause.p: Two questionnaires were conducted in 2006 to understand:

li.p: What feature sets were currently supported

example.p: What would you like to be able to do with your device that you cannot do right now?

âSync reliablyâ
âPower on quickly :-)â
âSyncML! Synchronize the calendarâ
âUse the calendar better, and sync it with PC appsâ¦ââ
âHandle events in different time zonesâ

li.p: iCalendar is the standard for interoperable exchange of calendaring information
It is widely used and is being actively developed
However, it has limited adoption within the mobile industry
TC Mobile produced a white paper to promote wider adoption of iCalendar on mobile devices. It covers
The differences between vCalendar and iCalendar
It will describe technical requirements, recommendations and future mobile-specific possibilities
We hope this will help explain the relevance of CalDAVto mobile devices
Regular face to face events and virtual testing
CalConnect is considering a mobile event in 2009
